data.name: "C’est Noir" Imperial Stout
data.description: 10.8% ABV 70 IBU’s A rich and creamy stout with loads of roasted barley and roasted oats infused with 70 IBU’s of hop bitterness to balance this really big beer. (SAY NOIR)

style.name: British-Style Imperial Stout
style.description: Dark copper to very dark brown, British-style imperial stouts typically have high alcohol content. The extremely rich malty flavor (often characterized as toffee-like or caramel-like) and aroma are balanced with medium hopping and high fruity-ester characteristics. Bitterness should be moderate and balanced with sweet malt character. The bitterness may be higher in the darker versions. Roasted malt astringency is very low or absent. Bitterness should not overwhelm the overall character. Hop aroma can be subtle to moderately hop-floral, -citrus or -herbal. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: Working Man Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Working Man Brewing is Livermore’s newest brewery, located at 5542 Brisa Street, just off of Vasco Road.  Getting the brewery up and running has been a labor of love for the owners, taking the better part of 18 months to turn the space into a full production brewery.  We are excited to finally bring our love of beer and commitment to quality to Livermore, the Tri-Valley, and beyond.

Our story is one of two independent breweries, Mt. Diablo Brewing and Working Man Brewing Company, coming together to work on one common goal.  Both companies were founded by award-winning home brewers who have a passion to bring high quality, well crafted beer that is fresh and local.  A chance meeting brought these working men together; a shared vision now combines forces under one name, Working Man Brewing Company.

The company’s brewers have each have spent years working to perfect great beer recipes.  Beer geeks at heart, both will tinker and tweak the ingredients until the product is just right.  The main goal always being to make a beer they could be proud to share and proud to drink. We never let a beer go out the door that we don’t believe in.

data.name: Alexander's Russian Imperial Stout
data.description: The first time we brewed the Russian we didn't think we'd get all the grain in the mash tun. Until Ohio liquor laws allowed us to exceed 6% alcohol by weight, this was as big as brewing workouts got here. The result is a roasty, fruity beer that you might be tempted to eat with a spoon.
data.foodPairings: This one pairs up beautifully with dark chocolate; also try chocolate-and-fruit desserts, such as stout cheesecake with raspberry sauce, or something with caramel or pecans. Stilton and walnuts; chocolate baked Alaska.

breweries.name: Palmetto Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us?

Tasting Room hours are:
Tues-Thurs 3pm - 9pm
Fri-Sat 1pm - 10pm

Founded by Jay and Lori Wince in 2006 Weasel Boy Brewing Company began brewing operations in July of 2007. The brewpub brews mostly traditional style ales specializing in well balanced session strength offerings. 
Winners of GABF medals in both 2010 (bronze) and 2012 (gold) for their Anastasia Russian Imperial Stout, Weasel Boy is well recognized for brewing high quality products. 
The brewpub offers artisan pizza made with fresh local ingredients, supports local art and music, and regularly participates in community events benefiting local causes.

breweries.name: Two Roads Brewing Company

Two Roads isn’t just the logo on our brewery building, it’s our philosophy. Life always seems to offer up two ways to go. It just so happens, we prefer the one less taken and having some fun along the way – in our lives, our careers and especially for our beers!
Now our “road less traveled” philosophy is being brought to life in the beers that we create and how we create them.

breweries.name: Hoppin' Frog Brewery
breweries.description:
Hoppin’ Frog is a small, hands-on brewery making very flavorful beers in the most flavorful beer styles. We brew high quality beers with an uncompromising focus on detail, from the ingredient selection to the brewing process. A specially designed JV Northwest brewing system creates more flavorful beers by allowing more barley to be used in the brewing process.  We also use a special bottling machine that keeps the beer fresher, and extends storage times compared to other conventional microbrewery bottling machines. This is very beneficial to retain all the character of these flavorful styles of beer.

Hoppin’ Frog is the concept of owner and established brewmaster Fred Karm, who has designed and produced more award-winning beers than any other professional brewer in Ohio since 2000. All of these awards were won at the 2 most prestigious contests in the world, including the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup. Mr. Karm has been a brewer of specialty beers since 1994, a life-long Akron, Ohio resident, and is a graduate of the University Of Akron.

data.name: B/A/Y/S V3.0 - Cabernet Sauvignon (Ghost 414)
data.description: Tear off your suit-and-tie straightjacket. Submerge yourself in the riches of an alternate life, outside the corporate fishbowl. Obscured in the depths of this Russian Imperial Stout is the dark fruit of shadowy contemplation. Linger too long, ponder too deeply, and you may find your humanity is indelibly etched with the inkblot that is your soul.

breweries.name: Sun King Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 27,000 barrels of beer in 2014 while selling all of it in Indiana. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.

breweries.name: Black Acre Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Black Acre Brewing Co. is a new small batch brewery located in Irvington, Indiana. The idea for Black Acre initially was conceived in 2010 due to our love of brewing, great beer, and the beer community at large. We created Black Acre with the goal of contributing delicious and unique beers to the community in which we live.

Black Acre hand crafts its ales using a custom fabricated 3 barrel electric brewing system. The brewery will produce four house beers along with an ever rotating selection of seasonal and specialty beers. Distribution will be primarily though in house tap room sales although there will be limited outside distribution. Our beers are not ready quite yet, but stop by for a glass of one of our delicious guest taps and meet the staff.

data.name: Bert's Disqualified Imperial Stout
data.description: Berkshire County homebrewer Bert Holdredge won the ‘Brewers Choice’ prize in the 2011 New York City Homebrew Competition with this recipe (the prize was for a commercial batch to be brewed on our system) – but was disqualified from the official BJCP competition since he’d forgotten to remove a label from a bottle. A dangerously drinkable pitch-black stout with rich chocolate and peat smoke notes, and just a hint of alcohol warmth.

data.name: Bishop's Barrel No. 1
data.description: Pours a black color with a very light head that dissipates quickly. The nose is all bourbon and chocolate. The taste starts with a mix of spice with the bourbon and chocolate emerging and lingering through the finish. The light carbonation keeps the beer from becoming cloying, almost giving it a perception of lightness. A pleasant sipping beer with the bourbon both present but not overpowering as you work your way through the glass. Oddly easy to drink for a beer this strong.

breweries.name: Saint Arnold Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saint Arnold Brewing Company, located in Houston, is Texas' Oldest Craft Brewery. Our goal is to brew world class beers and deliver them to our customers as fresh as possible making them the best beers in Texas and Louisiana. Our customers are beer lovers - people that appreciate great, full-flavored beers.

Our small crew does everything at the brewery: brew the beer, filter the beer, keg the beer, bottle the beer, sell the beer and drink the beer. For us, this is a passion, not a job. We believe that this comes through in the beers we make. Our beers have soul.

We brew several different beers; some are year round, some are seasonal and a few are single batch brews. They are available in bars, restaurants, grocery stores, liquor stores and warehouse stores throughout Texas and Louisiana.

Our first keg of beer was shipped on June 9, 1994. Founded by Brock Wagner and Kevin Bartol, we chose Houston because, other than living here, this was the largest city in the country that did not have a microbrewery. Brock was a longtime homebrewer and had considered opening a brewery as far back as college, although that was quickly dismissed as a silly idea. Seven years after graduating, Brock revisited the idea, enlisted Kevin's help and the brewery was off and running. Kevin has since left the business after a bitter battle. (Just kidding - but don't you wish people wrote that when it was the truth?).

Please visit us if you are in Houston. We have a public open house every weekday at 3:00 PM and every Saturday starting at 11:00 AM.

Cheers!

Blue Ridge Brewing Co. is an established restaurant and brewery, offering 15 years of experience brewing only the finest of home brews and cooking an extraordinary array of unique dishes. Please, stop on by!

Born in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Greenville's Brew-Pub continues to pay homage to one simple creed, to provide our customers the very best we can! We're as proud of Chef Rich's House-Made Menu as we are of Jay's Freshly Crafted Brews!

data.name: Black Knight
data.description: An Imperial Stout brewed with 6 row malt, chocolate malt and caramel malt with molasses and Carroll County  honey added. A dark, roasted malt flavor that is bittersweet.  All Cascade whole flower hops used.

style.name: British-Style Imperial Stout
style.description: Dark copper to very dark brown, British-style imperial stouts typically have high alcohol content. The extremely rich malty flavor (often characterized as toffee-like or caramel-like) and aroma are balanced with medium hopping and high fruity-ester characteristics. Bitterness should be moderate and balanced with sweet malt character. The bitterness may be higher in the darker versions. Roasted malt astringency is very low or absent. Bitterness should not overwhelm the overall character. Hop aroma can be subtle to moderately hop-floral, -citrus or -herbal. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: COAST Brewing Company
breweries.description: COAST Brewing Company is a family owned craft brewery, on an old Navy base. We make beer we like to drink, simple and done well. We believe in choice organic and local ingredients. But it's not just about being organic, it's a certain mind set of considering the environment in everything we do. In fact, we're not certified organic and have no plans to be-we do it because we believe it's the right thing. All of our ingredients are listed including which are organic. Welcome and thanks for your continued support!

data.name: Bourbon Barrel Aged Anastasia
data.description: We took our two time GABF medal winning Anastasia and aged it for 9 months in red wine barrels to add complex notes of oak and red wine to the rich, bold, chocolate, roast and coffee-like flavors. Brewed with pale and chocolate malts with loads of roasted barley and Centennial hops!

breweries.name: Weasel Boy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded by Jay and Lori Wince in 2006 Weasel Boy Brewing Company began brewing operations in July of 2007. The brewpub brews mostly traditional style ales specializing in well balanced session strength offerings. 
Winners of GABF medals in both 2010 (bronze) and 2012 (gold) for their Anastasia Russian Imperial Stout, Weasel Boy is well recognized for brewing high quality products. 
The brewpub offers artisan pizza made with fresh local ingredients, supports local art and music, and regularly participates in community events benefiting local causes.

breweries.name: Flat12 Bierwerks
breweries.description:
Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. 

Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.

breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

data.name: Brutus Imperial Stout
data.description: It took an excessively insidious human being to have the word “Brutal” added to the dictionary on his account. Marcus Junius Brutus the younger is one such individual. The infamous assassin of Julius Caesar, Brutus is forever regarded as one deserving of his name. Pitch black in body, Brutus wields his weapons of chocolate malt, roasted barley, and oatmeal to wreak havoc on your tastebuds. With a body thick enough to coat your palate and leave his stain forever in your memory, Brutus invites you to join him in his dark quest for control of the known world. OG: 27.4 degrees Plato Malts: American Two-Row, Dextrine Malt, American Chocolate, Roasted Barley, Rolled Oats Hops: Warrior

breweries.name: Pollyanna Brewing Company
breweries.description:
"Pollyanna" is defined as irrepressibly optimistic. It reflects the idea of finding something to be glad about in every situation.

Opening a production brewery and taproom is a time consuming and calculated process that certainly requires plenty of optimism. We want to share with you our beer, our passion, and the optimistic approach that has led us to this point.

We're excited to build new memories and experiences as well as enrich our local community by always keeping the glass half-full. We're opening soon, so hang tight!

We are local beer enthusiasts, and we have carefully hand-crafted a variety of unique beers for your enjoyment. We also have an exciting menu of appetizers, pizzas and sandwiches, all baked in our wood-fired pizza oven. So, stop in for lunch with your co-workers, bring the family for dinner, or meet your friends for a few brews after work. We're waiting for you!

data.name: Cold War
data.description: Once every winter, we release our Russian Imperial Stout, Cold War. Rich, dark, and luscious, this beer has a surprising smoothness for such a high alcohol beer. Notes of coffee, chocolate, and figs on the palate will finish with malty sweetness that will make you want to come back for more. This beer is only available for a limited time, so grab it while you can!

breweries.name: Urban Legend Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Urban Legend Brewing Company makes unique beers the traditional way. Beer is our passion. We believe that our beer can make the world and our local community a better place! We use only the highest quality ingredients and make small batches to ensure that we supply our community with the purest, freshest, highest quality beer possible. Our goal is to support local businesses and American manufacturing wherever possible. We are committed to recycling, reusing, and reducing our carbon footprint while at the same time making unique beers for discerning beer lovers and craft beer newbies. We will think local and will contribute to the local economy. 
The beer we produce will be available in our brewery and at local bars, restaurants and liquor stores. Fresh beer always tastes the best! Pints in the taproom, growlers to go, and small scale, local distribution is our way of ensuring our product is in its prime when it gets to your glass. We have a number of staple beers on draught plus we will be providing a rotating line of seasonal and specialty brews. We love to rediscover ancient beer recipes as well as spend a lot of time developing a unique styles.
As we say.....Great Beer, Born Here.

data.name: Comrade Warmer
data.description: Our take on the classic Russian Imperial Stout. With a bit of coffee aroma up front, Comrade Warmer’s full-bodied cocoa and licorice flavor fades to a gentle alcohol warmth on the finish.

breweries.name: Hi-Fi Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
The needle first dropped into the groove in 2009, when John and Ryan bumped into each other at the Craft Brewers Conference. They were members of the same homebrew club back home (the Mt. Si Brewing Society in Snoqualmie – no rules, no dues, just beer), but hadn’t realized that they shared a dream to “go pro.”

Upon his return from that conference, John started riffing on a business plan, and eventually turned up the volume to include his wife Cathy, Ryan, and fellow Mt. Si club member Joe.

After a few meetings, we found our resonant frequency as a group: an honest, straightforward approach to beer and to business.

The name Hi-Fi Brewing is a reflection of that approach. We maintain a high level of fidelity to our customers, our suppliers, our employees, and our beer.

breweries.name: Meantime Brewing Company Limited
breweries.description:
Based in Greenwich and fiercely proud of its London roots, Meantime has won a worldwide reputation for beers of great quality and provenance.

Meantime was the first British brewery to win any medals at the World Beer Cup in 2004 and is the only British brewery to have won medals at every World Beer Cup since. It was the first British brewery to produce a Fairtrade beer and is the only British brewey that can put a champagne cork in a beer bottle. It is also the sole beer supplier tot he Saisnbury's Taste the Difference Range.

Four of its beers were rated in the World Top 50 by the International Beer Challenge 2007 and 2008

data.name: Cyber Monday
data.description: Cyber Monday is a smooth, full bodied, black as night stout with plenty of bourbon on the nose and hints of tart cherry. It’s heavy mouthfeel leads into distinct flavors of whisky and cherry that ends with a nice long toasty finish. This Russian Imperial Stout with cherries was aged for 10 months in 12 year bourbon barrels.

breweries.name: MobCraft Beer
breweries.description:
MOBCRAFT IS THE WORLD’S FIRST COMPLETELY CROWDSOURCED BREWERY!

MobCraft Beer is a small craft brewery making custom craft beer. We produce small batch “custom craft beers” based off of users submitted recipes and ideas which end up in our recipe vault. Each month, you can vote on a wide variety of beer styles and flavors. Cast your vote by pre-ordering the beer you want us to brew. MobCraft will produce the beer with the most orders and ship out a 4 pack of 22oz “bomber” bottles to your doorstep! Or if you're near the brewery come pick it up in our tap room location in Madison, WI!

data.name: Deslogetown Imperial Stout
data.description: It's a big, bold Imperial Stout...need we say more?

style.name: British-Style Imperial Stout
style.description: Dark copper to very dark brown, British-style imperial stouts typically have high alcohol content. The extremely rich malty flavor (often characterized as toffee-like or caramel-like) and aroma are balanced with medium hopping and high fruity-ester characteristics. Bitterness should be moderate and balanced with sweet malt character. The bitterness may be higher in the darker versions. Roasted malt astringency is very low or absent. Bitterness should not overwhelm the overall character. Hop aroma can be subtle to moderately hop-floral, -citrus or -herbal. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: Deslogetown Brewery
breweries.description:
Founded by Greg and Kristie Camp, Deslogetown Brewery started in 2009 as a simple homebrewing hobby in a basement on the west side of Desloge, Missouri.  Back in the area's formative years as a lead mining boomtown, Deslogetown referred to the company town that formed around the Desloge Consolidated Lead Mining Company.  While the lead mines are just a part of our area's history, the spirit of creating something with your own hands and hard work lives on.

So what happens when a couple of homebrewers get together with an accomplished vineyard and winery? The Ale House at St. Francois Winery! Thanks to Edward "Skip" Daugherty, owner/operator of St. Francois Winery, the dream of not just bringing local, handcrafted wines to the public, but local, handcrafted beer as well is a reality.

Today, the Deslogetown Brewery seeks to provide approachable craft brews without all the fuss - instead we hope to expand your beer palate with a beer that you will find delicious and refreshing.

​Open FRIDAY 4pm-7pm
SATURDAY 1pm-7pm
SUNDAY 1pm-5pm
1669 Pine Ridge Trail, off Highway 32, between Park Hills and Bismarck

data.name: Dirty Secret Russian Imperial Stout
data.description: This big stout can please even the most notorious of rulers. Conditioning on French chocolate oak and vanilla bourbon beans produces big notes of chocolate intertwined with subtle undertones of vanilla and bourbon.

breweries.name: Bombshell Beer Company
breweries.description:
Bombshell Beer Company’s 5,840 sq. ft building is conveniently located in the heart of Holly Springs within the Omni business park located off N.Main St. The building will house the production brewery, lab and a 1400 sq. ft. tasting room.
Our brewery features a custom designed 15 BBL steam fired brewhouse manufactured by SMT Food and Beverage Systems of Stokesdale NC. Our equipment is crafted by US workers and made of US stainless steel, a key factor of why we selected SMT as our equipment manufacturer. Supporting American workers and American Industry was important to the Bombshell founders.
Bombshell’s brewhouse features a two vessel system consisting of a mash tun complete with rakes and steam jacket for step infusion mashing and a combination brew kettle/whirlpool. A thirty barrel hot liquor tank and dual stage high efficiency plate and frame heat exchanger round out Bombshell’s brewhouse system. Initially two 15BBL and one 30BBL multi zone jacketed fermentation vessels and a 30BBL bright tank will be utilized in the production of Bombshell’s high quality, craft beers.
We will showcase our hand-crafted beers to the public in a new 1400 sq. ft. tasting room scheduled opening is which is planned to be open to visitors in July. The tasting room will offer sample flights, pints, and beer to go in growlers and kegs. Brewery tours and private event programs will also be available.
Bombshell Beer is owned by Ellen Joyner, Michelle Miniutti and Jackie Hudspeth.

data.name: Divine Right Imperial Stout
data.description: So named after the Russian Imperial Court’s firm believe that they ruled by "divine right," this Russian Imperial Stout is based off of Thale’s first recipe to be send to Catherine the Great. With earthy chocolate, dark sweet fruit, damp earth and whisky notes, this 9.2% ABV oily elixir finishes with considerable bitterness and roast (90 IBUs). Taste this and think of those early Baltic days or drink two and forget you read this literature.

breweries.name: Hogshead Brewery
breweries.description: Hogshead Brewery and Tap Room has been designed and developed to provide a variety of beers with an emphasis on English ales in a warm and inviting atmosphere with a neighborhood friendly feel. The Slo-Hi location was developed to allow a local clientele, as well as beer aficionados and lovers of good times a central spot in Denver to enjoy a proper pint and have a chat. We will always have three to four great beers on tap via CO2 pressurized kegs and plan to maintain properly conditioned Real Ale from naturally carbonated casks served from beer engines for those that enjoy this traditional British libation. The brewing system and associated cellar has been custom designed with an integrated control system, that allow the brewer to process from one to ten barrels in a batch process and ferment in temperature controlled Stainless Steel vessels. Each of the beers have been formulated from carefully selected malted barley, treated water, multiple varieties of hops, and a specific yeast strain to produce the flavor, mouth-feel, alcohol content, aroma and bitterness, as well as the complex flavor profile according to the time and temperature recipe intended by the brewer. In addition to the attention to detail required for consistent and repeatable brews the brewmaster and support personnel follow a disciplined regiment of cleaning manually, and automatically with Clean-In-Place Systems (CIP) to exclude off-flavors, contaminants, and other undesirables in our beers. Every beer we serve has been naturally processed without the assistance of filtration which is why we are intensely focused on the highest quality ingredients, temperature controls, and finish aging to serve a quality product that we hope you enjoy as much as we do.

data.name: Dog A
data.description: Dog A is a 15.1% Imperial Stout brewed with copious amounts of dark malts, pure cacao and coffee, balanced by the subtle addition of naga chilli. Perfect for ageing in your cellar or drinking fresh if you are lucky enough to get your paws on a bottle.

breweries.name: BrewDog Ltd
breweries.description:
BrewDog is a Scottish craft brewery located in the town of Fraserburgh, Aberdeenshire.

BrewDog was founded in 2006 by friends James Watt and Martin Dickie. The brewery at the Kessock Industrial Estate in Fraserburgh produced its first brew in April 2007. It is Scotland's largest independently owned brewery producing about 120,000 bottles per month for export all over the world.

data.name: Dogwatch Stout
data.description: A smooth creamy stout that has strong hop taste which leaves a smokey chocolate aftertaste on the palate.Dogwatch stout gets its name from the naval terminology for the shift period between 16.00hrs and 20.00hrs. This period of work is split into two, the first and the last dogwatch. The name dogwatch is thought to have come from the two ?half watches? being referred to as ?dodging the watch?. This later evolved into ?dodge watch? and then ?dog watch?

breweries.name: Nelson Brewery
breweries.description:
The brewery was first brought to the Historic Dockyard at Chatham as the Flagship Brewery in 1995 where it established a five barrel kit brewing up to 100 firkins a week. All the ales have nautical themed names to gel with the surroundings in which it is brewed


In 2003 the brewery was bought and renamed the Nelson Brewing Company to fall in line with the most famous naval hero of all time 'Admiral Horatio Nelson' and that his flagship 'The Victory' was built here in Chatham Dockyard.

In July 2006 the brewery was purchased by Piers Macdonald. Piers has over 20 years experience in the brewing industry and is passionate to keep the traditions of Kent brewing alive. Using the best ingredients and the finest Kent hops, combined with the expertise and dedication of his brewing staff, Piers plans to build on the brewery's already growing reputation as the provider of some of the tastiest ales on the market.

Now brewing from a seven and a half barrel kit and regularly having over a dozen ales of various strengths and taste available, the brewery is sure to have a beer to suit all!
